summary: This is a formal Touhy request letter from the law firm Edwards Pottinger LLC to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, seeking documentary and tangible evidence related to the sexual abuse of a victim named Priscilla Doe by Jeffrey Epstein. The request is made to support the victim's claim in the civil case 'Priscilla Doe v. Darren K. Indyke, et al.' and her participation in the Epstein Victim Compensation Program.

Priscilla Doe is the plaintiff in the civil case against defendant Darren K. Indyke, as referenced in the letter.

events.title: Formal Touhy Evidence Request
events.description: The law firm Edwards Pottinger LLC submits a formal written request under Touhy regulations to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York for documentary and tangible evidence related to the sexual abuse of Priscilla Doe by Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Establishment of Epstein Victim Compensation Program
events.description: The letter references the establishment of the Epstein Victim Compensation Program, which is currently underway, as a reason for seeking evidence on an expedited basis for Priscilla Doe's claim.

locations: 425 North Andrews Avenue Suite 2 Fort Lauderdale, FL 33301
86 Chambers Street, Third Floor New York Office
keyFacts: The document is a formal Touhy request from attorneys representing a victim, Priscilla Doe, seeking evidence from the DOJ related to her abuse by Jeffrey Epstein.
The request seeks 12 categories of documents including photographs, videos, correspondence, gift/payment records, and any documents containing Priscilla Doe's true name.
The request is made to support the victim's claim in the civil case 'Priscilla Doe v. Darren K. Indyke, et al.' and her participation in the Epstein Victim Compensation Program.
The letter emphasizes that the request does not seek classified information, informant identities, or investigatory records that would interfere with ongoing law enforcement proceedings.
The document reveals ongoing legal efforts by victims' attorneys to obtain government-held evidence for civil claims related to the Epstein case.
